DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Other Malignant Neoplasm Performed Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the other surgery related to the tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Other Malignant Neoplasm Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the additional or unspecified diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue involved with an tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
